title: Cellular PHY Systems Engineer - Beamforming
summary: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Dynamic, smart people and inspiring, innovative technologies are the norm here. Join us to help deliver the next groundbreaking Apple product.
description: Design and simulate state-of-the-art physical layer wireless communication algorithms with emphasis on beam management. Work closely with firmware, RF and other cross-functional teams to implement, verify and bringup beam management algorithms. Ensure that performance meets expectations. Work on next generation algorithms and implementation per roadmap.
key_qualifications: In-depth knowledge of wireless communication systems (5G, LTE, 802.11) with emphasis on millimeter-wave technology (5G NR FR2, 802.11ad). Ability to develop algorithms, assess performance, develop complexity-performance tradeoff, and work closely with firmware teams on implementation. Familiarity with bring up process and methodology. Experience with power/performance optimization.
preferred_qualifications: Knowledge of one ore more of the following areas – array signal processing, RF impairments related to mmwave deployments, firmware partitioning, firmware interface design and beamforming algorithms.
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $143,100 and $264,200, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.
